website_summaries.verdict: Bi-metal metal cutting band saw blade capable of cutting hard and soft metals.
pros: Bi-metal band saw blade suitable for cutting thin pipe tube profiles, and perfect for soft metal, as reflected by tpi (teeth per inch)
Accommodates all band saws utilizing given blade dimensions
Received overwhelmingly positive reviews from purchasers
Reasonably priced compared to similar products
cons: Not many complaints, but use on softer metals
Doesn't hold up well to stainless steel cutting, apparently

customer_reviews.title: Better than a Craftsman blade at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: my small home Band Saw is used to cut a variety of materials ranging from sheet steel, various grades of grades wood, and plastics. I hate changing blades constantly, and tend to use the same blade for everything. I've had this blade on the saw for several weeks and just held up well against my intermittent use. I would say that it is a better quality than its Craftsman equivalent.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: A very good blade, worked well for my application
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good blade, Cut through a sheet of steel like it was butter. I was concerned as to whether it would work as I'm using it on a lower-end Craftsman band saw with no ability to slow down the blade for cutting metal, but this worked flawlessly. I did put some oil on the metal I was cutting just to be safe. I also used it on some hardwood where I needed a cleaner cut, and it worked very well. I highly recommend this blade and the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas D.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived on time, ok quality
customer_reviews.text: Blades are a bit soft so depending on material dull quickly. Good cheep blade for general purpose work
customer_reviews.author: les

customer_reviews.title: Strong, Durable Blade That Fits My Oddball Band Saw Well
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to replace the factory saw blade that came with my band saw and this one was excellent. I typically perform cuts with pretty tight accuracy, and after properly setting my saw up for this wider blade, it zips though whatever I am cutting with a very smooth and small kerf. Exactly what I was looking for, and I'll be buying another one as my backup blade.
customer_reviews.author: Lu

customer_reviews.title: Yet another warehouse "deal" gone bad
customer_reviews.text: The blade is clearly marked on one side "machinist m42 68 inch x1/2 inch x 0.025 x 14tpi". It appears to be a perfectly good blade that just happens to be 2 1/2" too short for my bandsaw, which takes a 70 1/2" blade.
customer_reviews.author: Sherweld

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It couldn't cut through 1/4 round stock mild steel. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Cut through inch and a half brass with ease. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Edaburn

customer_reviews.title: SOFT METALS ONLY!
customer_reviews.text: This blade is only good for VERY SOFT METALS! If you plan on cutting ANY steel, don't waste your money on this blade. It will dull very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, just don't cut into a area that was ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, just don't cut into a area that was plasma cut, it will trash the blade in a second. Cuts aluminum and mild steel like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Stringham

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Used on my 10" Craftsman to cut knife blanks. So far so good. Make sure you have some tap fluid to keep the situation cool.
customer_reviews.author: Adam D.

customer_reviews.title: Blade is probably not good for bandsaw with no speed control
customer_reviews.text: The product did not do what I was hoping it would, but the is probably the fault of the saw. It cuts wood fairly well but did not cut aluminum or mild steel very well.
customer_reviews.author: RBaker

customer_reviews.title: Using this blade on my bandsaw did a much better job,faster job than using a hack saw or jigsaw!
customer_reviews.text: I used this blade to cut into 1/16” aluminum sheets for a project I’m working on. I was thinking of using a jigsaw....but felt that the vibration of the jigsaw would cause damage to the thin metal!
customer_reviews.author: Ric Maciel

customer_reviews.title: Good blade.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this blade a couple of times, but it seems to be a good quality product. I noticed some ripple at the weld, but I didn't notice any adverse effects.
customer_reviews.author: KenfromPS

customer_reviews.title: Cheap blade. Worked well on wood but no good on metal.
customer_reviews.text: Cut through my 1/8 steel sheets for about an hour. Then it was shot. Worked well at first but dulled and became worthless
customer_reviews.author: Susan S.

customer_reviews.title: got dull right away
customer_reviews.text: Cut literally 1/2" of a 10 guage steel plate and that was the end of it, got dull right away
customer_reviews.author: doc.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through everything i've tried pretty easily. Wood
customer_reviews.text: Fits my craftsmen bandsaw. Cuts through everything i've tried pretty easily. Wood, aluminium, plexiglass. It also dosen't seem to bend nearly as much as the other blades i've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Vishal Gupta

customer_reviews.title: good quality for reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: These blades arrived on time and fit my saw perfectly. Nice to be able to cut heavy aluminum stock.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Good for cutting metal
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp; does a great job cutting aluminum on my Craftsman 10" bandsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton E. Cramer

customer_reviews.title: Which it did cut fine. I had a problem with 1/2 inch conduit
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered the Sharpsaw blade a while back to cut sheet metal. Which it did cut fine. I had a problem with 1/2 inch conduit. The company rep, Frank, contacted me, discussed it with his tech people and replaced the blade. I like the 1/2 inch blade because it cuts long straight cuts. If you are need to cut curves a 1/4 inch would be better. Jim Sommer McMurray, PA
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Sommer

customer_reviews.title: Fits a Craftsman 10 band saw and cuts aluminum very well.
customer_reviews.text: Cutting aluminum on a Craftsman 10 band saw and this blade is working great. The teeth appear to be wearing well based on how it cuts. I am not at all disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark K

customer_reviews.title: Works well on soft metals such as brass or aluminum ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well on soft metals such as brass or aluminum. Do not use on stainless unless paper thin. Teeth dulled instantly on 3/16 in stainless.
customer_reviews.author: h123

customer_reviews.title: much better finishing. Seller quite willing to improve product to ...
customer_reviews.text: Greatly improved since originally supplied. No missing teeth, much better finishing. Seller quite willing to improve product to minimize imperfections
customer_reviews.author: Stan Saxenberg

customer_reviews.title: Good value good product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two for my craftsman 10 inch band saw. I use it primarily for cutting brass/nickel silver guards for my knife making These blades cut through both like a hot knife through butter. Seems to be an excellent value for the money. I would recommend these blades
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit, using it daily. Would order again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Benedict.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed I wasted money on a blade I can't use
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what the deal is with this blade, but it screams! When it arrived I stuck it on and cut some 1/4" and 3/8" mild steel just to see how it cut. It cut ok, but made a ton of noise. Ridiculous amount to say the least. I have a 10" Delta Rockwell saw made specifically for cutting steel. Can't figure out why this was so noisy. I just ordered a different blade so it shuts up. Disappointed I wasted money on a blade I can't use, even if it wasn't expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.MAGA

product_meta.title: Imachinist S701314 70-1/2-inch By 1/2-inch By 14tpi Bi-metal Soft Metal Cutting Band Saw Blades
feature_bullets: Bi-metal band saw blade 70-1/2" long, 1/2" wide, 0.025" thick, 14TPI
14tpi is suitable for cutting thin pipe tube profiles etc
14tpi is fixed teeth profile, teeth distance is 1.8mm per teeth
Suits all bandsaws which use 70-1/2" long, 1/2" wide bandsaw blade

specifications.Material: Bi-metal band saw blade 70-1/2" long, 1/2" wide, 14tpi
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars81 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
